org.netbeans.spi.java.hints

Annotation Type IntegerOption


  • @Retention(value=SOURCE)
 @Target(value=FIELD)
 @Documented
public @interface IntegerOption
    Declares an int-value option that affects hint processing. If the Hint mixes integer and boolean options, the integer options come first, boolean second in the UI.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String displayName 

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      int defaultValue 
      int maxValue
      Maximum value for the option.
      int minValue
      Minimum value for the option.
      int step
      If non-zero, a spinner will be created with the specified step.
      String tooltip 

    • Element Detail

      • displayName

        public abstract String displayName
        Returns:
        Display name of the option

      • tooltip

        public abstract String tooltip
        Returns:
        tooltip for mouse hover over the option
        Default:
        ""

      • defaultValue

        public abstract int defaultValue
        Returns:
        default value for the option
        Default:
        0

      • minValue

        public abstract int minValue
        Minimum value for the option. If Integer.MIN_VALUE (the default), no minimum will be enforced.
        Returns:
        minimum value.
        Default:
        0

      • maxValue

        public abstract int maxValue
        Maximum value for the option. If Integer.MAX_VALUE (the default), no maximum will be enforced. Please do choose a reasonable maximum value, as the UI may size the input box to accommodate all digits of the maximum permitted value, and the input box may seem unreasonably large.
        Returns:
        maximum value
        Default:
        2147483647

      • step

        public abstract int step
        If non-zero, a spinner will be created with the specified step. If zero (the default), a plain input will be presented. Negative values are not accepted at the moment and are reserved.
        Default:
        0
